sentences: Hän on vähiten suosittu opettaja koulussa.
Minulla on vähiten aikaa kuin kukaan muu.
context: Vähiten is the superlative form of vähä (little/few) in Finnish. It means 'the least' or 'at the minimum' and is used to indicate the smallest amount, quantity, or degree when comparing three or more things. It's formed by adding the suffix '-en' to the comparative form vähemmän (less), which follows Finnish superlative formation patterns.
